page.title: 10LOCAL CHELTENHAM HISTORY
page.content: {LOCAL HISTORY. Alstone}derives from Aelf's tun or settlement. A Saxon field name survives in{"Rowanfield", } meaning the field where two hay har- vests were cut annually. Nearby Monks croft was named after Richard Munke who,as a tenant, is mentioned in a document dated 1334. Much of the land was in Alstone Tything, an early manor later removed and rebuilt near the reservoir on the A40 near Cheltenham. Dr Jenner's country house (nick-named the Pest House)is now Purchasing and Cost Office of Spirax Sarco. Victorian cottage, originally a bakery, has dis- used door under roof with no outside access. Grain stored in barn, where Golden Miller Pub is now, was hoisted up through it. Oven in cellar removed but foundations still visible.
